thread.title: Director praises Mackay man for bringing film to town
thread.title_full: Director praises Mackay man for bringing film to town

title: Director praises Mackay man for bringing film to town
text:
Director praises Mackay man for bringing film to town Lucy Smith | 3rd Oct 2015 2:00 PM Lucy Smith Local Real Estate Cars For Sale 
GAYBY Baby director Maya Newell has praised Mackay resident Peter McCallum for responding to the film's offer to help host a screening. 
On the film's website is a link where people can apply to have the film screened in their town, giving access to people in regional areas. 
Ms Newell said Mr McCallum was one of the first to respond. 
"He sounds like a bit of a legend... he's one of the first to take it on with such a passion," Ms Newell said. 
"It's heart-warming when there's people in rural Australia who are willing to take this film into their local area... It's so powerful." 
The event going ahead was conditional on 58 people buying tickets to the screening at Mackay City Cinemas. 
At the time of writing 76 tickets had been sold. 
Maya Newell was inspired to make the film, with the tagline 'same-sex families told by the kids,' as she was raised by two mothers. 
The film garnered national attention after the New South Wales government banned its screening in schools. film
